COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

a.title: COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

div.a: COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

a.title: COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

div.a: COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

div.span: COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

div.h3: COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

span.span:
Remote Learning Q & A - Answers for the most common remote learning questions from Dr. Anastasia
Correspondence from Dr. Steven Nilhas - Concerning Curriculum, Instruction, and Assessment
A Guide to Remote Learning for Parents - A guide created by Dr. Steve Nilhas, SAU 36 Director of Curriculum, Instruction, and Assessment, to connect parents with apps and websites to supplement remote learning
A Parents' Guide to Google Classroom- Everything you need to know to get up and running on Google Classroom
Social and Emotional Learning Resources- From our System of Care office, a library of resources to promote SEL from home, including COVID-19 talking points for children
Substance Misuse Supports in NH - Links to agencies and websites to support substance misuse treatment and recovery
Free Recovery Support Apps - Links and information for free smartphone apps to support substance misuse recovery
Community Resources - Emergency COVID-related local resources
Community Resources - Contact information for community support resources including housing, food, clothing, childcare, and much more
Family Well-Being Guide - Questions to ask, agency contact, and other support information (including financial, food, housing, and neglect/abuse)
WMRSD Meal Delivery Information - Delivery times and locations
NH Learns Alliance - Resources for educators, schools, and parents

a.title: Link opens in a new window

br.span: - Information, tools, and strategies to support students

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);
text-decoration: underline; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

p.span: April 21, 2020
Dear WMRSD Families,
As the well-deserved vacation approaches, Id like to give you some information concerning the rest of the year.

First, students will have an early release from remote learning on Friday, April 24th at 12:30 PM. There will be no parent conferences on that day. You should have received your childs report card this week.
Vacation week is from Monday, April 27th through Friday, May 1st. Meals will be delivered on two days during the vacation week. Same time and place as your usual delivery!

strong.span: Delivery (April 29): meals for Wednesday, Thursday, & Friday

em.span: The District Leadership Team will be helping our paraprofessionals deliver meals these days!

p.span: We have some tentative dates for the end of year celebrations. These are all contingent on the Governors orders on social distancing, of course. The Principals will be updating families with logistics along the way. Mark your calendars!
Graduation: Friday, August 7th
Scholarship Awards: Thursday, August 6th
Class night: Wednesday, August 5th
Prom: Combine Junior and Senior prom during 2020-21 school year
NC Scholars : Through NCES, newspaper articles and social media
Other events will be held in the Fall of 2020
8th Grade Graduation & Awards Celebrations August 10th combined with a cook out
Jr Honor society remotely date TBD
8th Grade Graduation & Awards Celebrations August 11th combined with a cook out
Jr Honor society remotely date TBD
The last day of school for students will be Friday, June 5, 2020.
According to
, Days of School, districts shall provide 180 days of schoolor equivalent number of hours.

em.span: {(a)Pursuant to RSA 189:1 and RSA 189:24, each school district shall maintain a school yearas provided:(1)The school district shall maintain in each elementary school, a school year of at least 945 hours of instructional time

p.span: WMRSD has exceeded the number of required hours as calculated that allows us to use this formula.

We are working with the NHDOE and USDA to obtain waivers for a summer feeding program. Presently, the waivers are in an application process with the State of NH. We will keep you updated as we know more about the waivers.

Lastly, I would like to announce that the WMRSD Board approved the nomination of Mr. Jacob Hess as the 2020-2021 Interim WMRSD Principal. Mr. Hess is currently the Assistant Principal of WMRHS and former WMRHS English teacher. Congratulations to Mr. Hess! The administrative team remains a 4-person team with Mr. Rob Scott and Mr. Michael Curtis. We will be replacing Mr. Hesss position with a Dean of Students & Instruction. We are excited to roll out the reorganization of this team in a letter to families after vacation!! More information to follow!
Enjoy your vacation and be well!
Best, Marion
